<div class="card-lead">
<p>While this years Black Friday sales have come and gone, people wont have to wait until next year to score name brand products at discounted prices because one of Ashlands newest stores aims to make every day Black Fridays. </p>

<div class="card-lead">
<p>In an effort to inspire shoppers to take advantage of the many local brick and mortar stores, the Ashland Area Chamber of Commerce is once again encouraging people to participate in their Shop Small, Win Big promotion and earn double points on purchases made on Small Business Saturday. </p>

<div class="card-lead">
<p>In just over a week, the Bayfield Carnegie Library will be partnering with their friends in Red Cliff to host the regions third annual Bayfield Comic/Sci-Fi Convention on Oct. 28 at the Legendary Waters Resort & Casino. </p>

<div class="card-lead">
<p>We were cooking with sunshine! We installed a solar array at our residence this fall and by Thanksgiving afternoon it was kicking out 3,000 watts. We have an electric oven. The Thanksgiving turkey was in the oven for five hours that sunny afternoon. So we were cooking with sunshine. </p>

Water for drinking, cooking, and making ice should be boiled and cooled prior to use.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">The water should be brought to a vigorous, rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water or obtain water from some other suitable source.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">When it is no longer necessary to boil the water, the water system officials will notify you that the water is safe for consumption.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Instructions to discontinue boiling will be issued in the same manner as this notice.</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><o:p /></span></p></div> ", "image": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "http://static.lakana.com/nxsglobal/myhighplains/photo/2013/07/18/Story_2287253_ver1.0_640_360.jpg", "height": "360", "width": "640" }, "video": { "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "boil order in paducah_6325843170914158882", "thumbnailUrl": "http://static.lakana.com/nxsglobal/myhighplains/photo/2015/07/25/53ab842bc05f_2836879_ver1.0_160_90.jpg", "contentUrl": "http://video-static.clipsyndicate.com/zStorage/syndicaster2/244/2014/06/26/02/23/53ab8429e61a.mp4", "dateCreated": "2015-07-25T18:54:30-0500", "dateModified": "2015-07-25T18:54:30-0500" } } </script> <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="content-type"/> <meta content="Boiling ensures destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes." lang="en-US" name="description"/> <meta content="water, boil" lang="en-US" name="keywords"/> <script>/*<![CDATA[*/var _head_start=new Date();/*]]>*/</script> <meta content="Boiling ensures destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes. <div class="StoryBlock"><a aria-controls="drop-geocode" aria-expanded="false" class="dateline" data-dropdown="drop-geocode"><i class="fa fa-map-marker"></i>Paducah, Texas</a> - 
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">PADUCAH -- Due to the main water supply being turned off to the City of Paducah due to the repair of a main line, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has required our water system, City of Paducah, to notify customers of the need to boil their water prior to consumption beginning Today.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Boiling ensures destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes. Water for drinking, cooking, and making ice should be boiled and cooled prior to use.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">The water should be brought to a vigorous, rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water or obtain water from some other suitable source.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">When it is no longer necessary to boil the water, the water system officials will notify you that the water is safe for consumption.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Instructions to discontinue boiling will be issued in the same manner as this notice.</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></p></div> <!-- story body ends --> <div class="pagination-centered"> <ul class="pagination"> </ul> </div> </div> <footer class="mod-footer"> <div class="footer-text"> <p class="copyright">Copyright 2017 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc.     var compatible = true;

    }catch(e){

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5607);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4669);

                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://journaltimes.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>TOWN OF BURLINGTON  Two Burlington-area beaches have bacterial levels that have warranted warnings for beach-goers.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journaltimes.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Today Bohners Lake Public Beach is closed due to high bacteria counts, and Leach Beachs water quality was deemed poor as bacterial levels in the water may cause illness, according to a press release sent by the Western Racine County Health Department.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journaltimes.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journaltimes.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>In the press release, the Health Department advises those who do go to Leach Beach, also located on Bohners Lake, to bathe after swimming and to avoid ingesting the water.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Bohners Lake Public Beach will be closed until bacterial levels of the water are lowered.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

<div class="StoryBlock">
<div><span style="font-weight: bold;">WEST CARROLL PARISH </span>-- A boil order is in effect for some West Carroll Parish residents.</div><div><br/></div><div>The Fiske Union Water System is experiencing problems with the water supply system.</div><div><br/></div><div>Because of these problems, the water is of questionable microbiological quality.</div><div><br/></div><div>As a precaution, the system is issuing a boil order advisory effective immediately.</div><div><br/></div><div>All consumers should disinfect their water before consuming it (including fountain drinks), making ice, brushing teeth, or using it for food preparations.</div><div><br/></div><div>Boil water for one full minute in a clean container. The one minute starts after the water has been brought to a rolling boil.</div></div> <!-- story body ends --> <div class="pagination-centered"> <ul class="pagination"> </ul> </div> </div> <footer class="mod-footer"> <div class="footer-text"> <p class="copyright">Copyright 2017 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc.     "name": "Boil water order in Anderson County canceled",
    "headline": "Boil water order in Anderson County canceled",
    "articleBody": "A boil water order in Anderson County has been cancelled, according to Anderson Regional Joint Water System.The advisory was issued Wednesday after a failure at a pump station when it comes to the intake from Lake Hartwell to the treatment facility, according to Anderson County officials.The advisory did include residents of the West Anderson Water District, Hammond Water District, town of Pendleton, Sandy Springs Water District, town of Williamston, Big Creek Water District, city of Clemson, Clemson University, Electric City Utilities, Homeland Park, Star-Iva Water district and Broadway Water.Questions\/concernsAnyone with questions concerning the notice should call the Joint Water System at 864-226-9676.",
    "datePublished": "2014-06-26T00:28:03Z",

<div class="article-content--body-teaser">
</div>
<div class="article-content--body-text">
<strong class="dateline">ANDERSON COUNTY, S.C. </strong> <p>A boil water order in Anderson County has been cancelled, according to Anderson Regional Joint Water System.</p><p>The advisory was issued Wednesday after a failure at a pump station when it comes to the intake from Lake Hartwell to the treatment facility, according to Anderson County officials.</p><div class="article-content--body-wrapper-side-floater ">
<!-- blocks/ad.twig -->
<div class="ad-rectangle ">
<div class="ad-container or-halfpage" data-loc="btf" data-type="rectangle"></div>
<div class="ad-label">Advertisement</div>
</div>
<!-- blocks/ad.twig -->
</div>
<p>The advisory did include residents of the West Anderson Water District, Hammond Water District, town of Pendleton, Sandy Springs Water District, town of Williamston, Big Creek Water District, city of Clemson, Clemson University, Electric City Utilities, Homeland Park, Star-Iva Water district and Broadway Water.</p><p><strong>Questions/concerns</strong></p><p>Anyone with questions concerning the notice should call the Joint Water System at 864-226-9676.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="article-content--footer">
</div>
</div>

</div>
